intro: Zinnia pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered zinnia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Its small, clustered flowers come in shades of yellow, orange, and red, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Zinnia pauciflora is also known for its resilience to drought and its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
